verses.kjv: Then Elisha said, Hear ye the word of the LORD; Thus saith the LORD, To morrow about this time shall a measure of fine flour be sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.
verses.web: Elisha said, “Hear LORD’s word. LORD says, ‘Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour will be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.’ ”
verses.ct: Elisha said, "Listen to the word of the LORD! The LORD says, 'By this time tomorrow, a seah of fine flour will sell for just a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, right at the gate of Samaria.'"

verses.kjv: Then a lord on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God, and said, Behold, if the LORD would make windows in heaven, might this thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt not eat thereof.
verses.web: Then the captain on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God, and said, “Behold, if LORD made windows in heaven, could this thing be?” He said, “Behold, you will see it with your eyes, but will not eat of it.”
verses.ct: The officer the king relied on most turned to the man of God and said, "Even if the LORD opened floodgates in the heavens, could such a thing happen?" Elisha replied, "You'll see it with your own eyes, but you won't get to eat any of it."

verses.kjv: And there were four leprous men at the entering in of the gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die?
verses.web: Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate. They said to one another, “Why do we sit here until we die?
verses.ct: Now there were 4 men with leprosy sitting at the entrance to the city gate. They said to each other, "Why are we just sitting here waiting to die?"

verses.kjv: If we say, We will enter into the city, then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there: and if we sit still here, we die also. Now therefore come, and let us fall unto the host of the Syrians: if they save us alive, we shall live; and if they kill us, we shall but die.
verses.web: If we say, ‘We will enter into the city,’ then the famine is in the city, and we will die there. If we sit still here, we also die. Now therefore come, and let’s surrender to the army of the Syrians. If they save us alive, we will live; and if they kill us, we will only die.”
verses.ct: "If we go into the city, the famine will kill us there. If we stay here, we'll die too. So let's go surrender to the Syrian army. If they spare us, we live. If they kill us — well, we were going to die anyway."

verses.kjv: And they rose up in the twilight, to go unto the camp of the Syrians: and when they were come to the uttermost part of the camp of Syria, behold, there was no man there.
verses.web: They rose up in the twilight, to go to the camp of the Syrians. When they had come to the outermost part of the camp of the Syrians, behold, no man was there.
verses.ct: So at twilight they got up and headed for the Syrian camp. But when they reached the edge of it, not a single person was there.

verses.kjv: For the LORD had made the host of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots, and a noise of horses, even the noise of a great host: and they said one to another, Lo, the king of Israel hath hired against us the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of the Egyptians, to come upon us.
verses.web: For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians to hear the sound of chariots, and the sound of horses, even the noise of a great army; and they said to one another, “Behold, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings of the Hittites and the kings of the Egyptians to attack us.”
verses.ct: The LORD had caused the Syrian army to hear what sounded like a massive force — the thunder of chariots, the pounding of horses, the roar of a huge army. The Syrians said to each other, "The king of Israel must have hired the Hittite kings and the Egyptian kings to attack us!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore they arose and fled in the twilight, and left their tents, and their horses, and their asses, even the camp as it was, and fled for their life.
verses.web: Therefore they arose and fled in the twilight, and left their tents, and their horses, and their donkeys, even the camp as it was, and fled for their life.
verses.ct: So they panicked and fled at twilight, abandoning their tents, their horses, and their donkeys — leaving the entire camp exactly as it was — and ran for their lives.

verses.kjv: And when these lepers came to the uttermost part of the camp, they went into one tent, and did eat and drink, and carried thence silver, and gold, and raiment, and went and hid it; and came again, and entered into another tent, and carried thence also, and went and hid it.
verses.web: When these lepers came to the outermost part of the camp, they went into one tent, and ate and drank, and carried away silver, gold, and clothing, and went and hid it. Then they came back, and entered into another tent, and carried things from there also, and went and hid them.
verses.ct: When the men with leprosy reached the edge of the camp, they went into one tent, ate and drank, then grabbed silver, gold, and clothing and went off to hide it. They came back, entered another tent, took more, and hid that too.

verses.kjv: Then they said one to another, We do not well: this day is a day of good tidings, and we hold our peace: if we tarry till the morning light, some mischief will come upon us: now therefore come, that we may go and tell the king’s household.
verses.web: Then they said to one another, “We aren’t doing right. Today is a day of good news, and we keep silent. If we wait until the morning light, punishment will overtake us. Now therefore come, let’s go and tell the king’s household.”
verses.ct: Then they said to each other, "What we're doing isn't right. This is a day of incredible news, and we're keeping it to ourselves! If we wait until morning, we'll be punished for this. Come on — let's go tell the king's household."

verses.kjv: So they came and called unto the porter of the city: and they told them, saying, We came to the camp of the Syrians, and, behold, there was no man there, neither voice of man, but horses tied, and asses tied, and the tents as they were.
verses.web: So they came and called to the city gatekeepers; and they told them, “We came to the camp of the Syrians, and, behold, there was no man there, not even a man’s voice, but the horses tied, and the donkeys tied, and the tents as they were.”
verses.ct: So they went back and called out to the city gatekeepers. They reported, "We went to the Syrian camp, and there's nobody there — not a single voice. The horses and donkeys are still tied up, and the tents are standing just as they were."

verses.kjv: And he called the porters; and they told it to the king’s house within.
verses.web: He called the gatekeepers; and they told it to the king’s household within.
verses.ct: The gatekeepers shouted the news, and word was carried inside to the king's household.

verses.kjv: And the king arose in the night, and said unto his servants, I will now shew you what the Syrians have done to us. They know that we be hungry; therefore are they gone out of the camp to hide themselves in the field, saying, When they come out of the city, we shall catch them alive, and get into the city.
verses.web: The king arose in the night, and said to his servants, “I will now show you what the Syrians have done to us. They know that we are hungry. Therefore are they gone out of the camp to hide themselves in the field, saying, ‘When they come out of the city, we shall take them alive, and get into the city.’ ”
verses.ct: The king got up in the middle of the night and told his officials, "Let me tell you what the Syrians are up to. They know we're starving, so they've left the camp and hidden in the fields. They're thinking, 'When the Israelites come out of the city, we'll capture them alive and then take the city.'"

verses.kjv: And one of his servants answered and said, Let some take, I pray thee, five of the horses that remain, which are left in the city, (behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel that are left in it: behold, I say, they are even as all the multitude of the Israelites that are consumed:) and let us send and see.
verses.web: One of his servants answered, “Please let some people take five of the horses that remain, which are left in the city. Behold, they are like all the multitude of Israel who are left in it. Behold, they are like all the multitude of Israel who are consumed. Let’s send and see.”
verses.ct: One of his officials replied, "Please, let's send a few men with 5 of the horses still left in the city. If they die, they're no worse off than the rest of us who are about to perish anyway. Let's send them to find out what's going on."

verses.kjv: They took therefore two chariot horses; and the king sent after the host of the Syrians, saying, Go and see.
verses.web: Therefore they took two chariots with horses; and the king sent them out to the Syrian army, saying, “Go and see.”
verses.ct: So they selected 2 chariots with horses, and the king sent them after the Syrian army with orders: "Go and see what happened."

verses.kjv: And they went after them unto Jordan: and, lo, all the way was full of garments and vessels, which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. And the messengers returned, and told the king.
verses.web: They went after them to the Jordan; and behold, all the path was full of garments and equipment which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. The messengers returned, and told the king.
verses.ct: They followed the trail all the way to the Jordan River, and the entire road was littered with clothing and equipment the Syrians had thrown aside as they fled in panic. The scouts returned and reported everything to the king.

verses.kjv: And the people went out, and spoiled the tents of the Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to the word of the LORD.
verses.web: The people went out and plundered the camp of the Syrians. So a seah of fine flour was sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to LORD’s word.
verses.ct: Then the people rushed out and plundered the Syrian camp. Just as the LORD had promised, a seah of fine flour sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley sold for a shekel.

verses.kjv: And the king appointed the lord on whose hand he leaned to have the charge of the gate: and the people trode upon him in the gate, and he died, as the man of God had said, who spake when the king came down to him.
verses.web: The king appointed the captain on whose hand he leaned to be in charge of the gate; and the people trampled over him in the gate, and he died as the man of God had said, who spoke when the king came down to him.
verses.ct: The king had put the officer he relied on in charge of the city gate. But the crowd trampled him in the gateway, and he died — exactly as the man of God had predicted when the king first came to see him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass as the man of God had spoken to the king, saying, Two measures of barley for a shekel, and a measure of fine flour for a shekel, shall be to morrow about this time in the gate of Samaria:
verses.web: It happened as the man of God had spoken to the king, saying, “Two seahs of barley for a shekel, and a seah of fine flour for a shekel, shall be tomorrow about this time in the gate of Samaria;”
verses.ct: It all happened just as the man of God had told the king: "By this time tomorrow, two seahs of barley will sell for a shekel, and a seah of fine flour for a shekel, at the gate of Samaria."

verses.kjv: And that lord answered the man of God, and said, Now, behold, if the LORD should make windows in heaven, might such a thing be? And he said, Behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt not eat thereof.
verses.web: and that captain answered the man of God, and said, “Now, behold, if LORD made windows in heaven, might such a thing be?” and he said, “Behold, you will see it with your eyes, but will not eat of it.”
verses.ct: That officer had responded to the man of God, "Even if the LORD opened floodgates in the heavens, could such a thing happen?" And Elisha had told him, "You'll see it with your own eyes, but you won't get to eat any of it."

verses.kjv: And so it fell out unto him: for the people trode upon him in the gate, and he died.
verses.web: It happened like that to him; for the people trampled over him in the gate, and he died.
verses.ct: And that's exactly what happened to him — the people trampled him in the gateway, and he died.
